title: String group
summary: In topology, a branch of mathematics, a string group is an infinite-dimensional group String ‚Å° ( n ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {String} (n)} introduced by Stolz (1996) as a 3 {\displaystyle 3} -connected cover of a spin group. A string manifold is a manifold with a lifting of its frame bundle to a string group bundle. This means that in addition to being able to define holonomy along paths, one can also define holonomies for surfaces going between strings. There is a short exact sequence of topological groups
